params.text: DNA Helicase, a large enzyme, separates the two strands of DNA so that they can act as templates for replication.
Single-strand binding proteins bind to each strand to stabilize and prevent them from reforming the double helix.
Primase, an RNA polymerase, binds to the single stranded DNA and synthesizes a short RNA primer in the 5’ to 3’ direction that is antiparallel to the parental strand.
Topoisomerase binds to the double helix upstream of the replication fork to prevent additional coiling by making small cuts in one of the DNA strands.
